greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 9*Sum_{k>=1} 1/(10^k-1).
comment: This constant is the infinite sum of the reciprocals of repunits, R_n, with n>0 (A002275). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Dec 06 2009
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 354-361.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..2000
Steven R. Finch, Digital Search Tree Constants [Broken link]
Steven R. Finch, Digital Search Tree Constants [From the Wayback machine]
formula: Equals 9 * sum(k>=1, (1+x^k)/(1-x^k) * x^(k^2) ) where x = 1/10.  This allows fast computation for this and similar sequences (involving sum(k>=1, x^k/(1-x^k) for some x < 1 ). - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 25 2016
mathematica: A065444=RealDigits[ Block[{$MaxExtraPrecision = 100}, N[9*Sum[(-1 + 10^i)^-1, {i, 1, Infinity}], 130]]][[1]] (* _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Dec 06 2009 *)
program: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 2080); x=9*suminf(k=1, 1/(10^k - 1)); for (n=1, 2000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b065444.txt", n, " ", d)) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 19 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 18 2001
